title: 105_hr1767
content:
The "Federal Surplus Property Reform Act of 1997" allows the Secretary of Defense special authorities for disposing of excess and surplus property. Expansion of Limitation on Use of Excess Nonlethal Supplies for International Assistance Programs: Section 2552 of title 10, United States Code, is amended to restrict the transfer of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense stocks to foreign countries or international organizations for foreign assistance, humanitarian assistance, and military sales programs. The amendment restricts the transfer of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense to foreign countries or international organizations for foreign assistance, humanitarian assistance, and military sales programs unless certain conditions are met. Nonlethal excess supplies are defined as property of the Department of Defense that is not a weapon, ammunition, or other equipment. Transfers can only occur if no State or eligible entity requests the supplies, or if the President certifies the transfer is necessary for emergency response. The amendment restricts the transfer of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense to foreign countries or international organizations unless certain conditions are met. Nonlethal excess supplies are defined as property that is not designed to inflict serious bodily harm or death. Amendments are made to Section 2547(a) and the table of sections in chapter 152 of the title. The amendment limits the use of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense in foreign assistance, humanitarian assistance, and military sales programs. It also eliminates the delegation of disposal authority over personal property to the Secretary of Defense. The amendment restricts the use of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense in various programs and removes the delegation of disposal authority over personal property to the Secretary of Defense. The amendment restricts the use of nonlethal excess supplies from the Department of Defense in various programs and removes the delegation of disposal authority over personal property to the Secretary of Defense. Additionally, support for Regional Equipment Centers in Newport township and Cambria county is repealed. SEC. 3. REPEAL OF AUTHORITY TO TRANSFER SURPLUS PROPERTY TO DISADVANTAGED SMALL BUSINESS CONCERNS ON PRIORITY BASIS. Amends the Small Business Act to remove the authority to transfer surplus property to disadvantaged small business concerns on a priority basis. 

SEC. 4. SURPLUS EQUIPMENT OF DEPARTMENT OF ENERGY RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT FACILITIES. Amends the Department of Energy Science Education Enhancement Act to modify the handling of surplus equipment at research and development facilities.

SEC. 5. EXCESS LABORATORY RESEARCH EQUIPMENT. Addresses the disposal of excess laboratory research equipment. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 is amended to delegate authority to directors of Federal laboratories for the transfer and disposal of scientific and technical surplus property. The Stevenson-Wydler Technology Innovation Act of 1980 amended to allow Federal laboratories directors to transfer surplus property for educational and research purposes.
